p: The most prevalent bacteria at the genus level in both groups of pigs were Prevotella, Clostridium, Barnesiella, Streptococcus, and Megasphaera ( Figure 3). Lactobacillus and Bifidobacterium were also detected with the prevalence from 3.5% to 5.5% (Lactobacillus) and from 2.2% to 2.9% ( Bifodobacterium). The overall genus variety and the number of predominant bacteria were similar among the groups with the highest difference found in the number of Prevotella, which was higher (27.2% vs. 17.2%) in the control animal group ( p < 0.05).
